page.title: 17The Museum:Chatteris(1)
page.content: Housed in an old nineteenth century farmbuilding,the museum was officially opened on 12 November, 1963 though its origins go back to 1942 when Mr Charles Dobbs set up a display in a small glass cabinet in one corner of the Urban Council Chambers. It was once described as"the smallest museum" in the country and was the first to be seen in this area. With enthusiasm and hard work the local exhibits have expanded to fill four rooms. The museum is open on Thursdays between 2pm and 4pm or by special arrangement. Since the museum opened the curator has been Mr Stone, a retired gentleman whose services are completely voluntary. He is assisted by the 'Friends of the Museum' who meet on the third Friday evening of each month. The running costs are paid by the parish council.
